isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLE: INTERNATIONAL - REMOVE

note.para: Steam clean axle assembly before removing carrier.
Wheel ends may have one bolt replacing a stud. This is thru-drilled into the cavity and can be used to drain and fill the wheel end.

step1.para: Drain lubricant from axle housing and power divider. To drain power divider, remove plugs from bottom of intermediate case.
Hold a large brass drift or brass hammer against the center of the axle shaft flange. Strike the drift with sharp blows from a large hammer or sledge until axle shaft separates from hub.

warning.para: Do not strike the axle flange directly with a steel hammer or sledge. This may crack and splinter material, possibly causing serious or fatal injury. Do not pry or chisel axle flange away from hub or damage to sealing surfaces could occur.

step1.para: Disconnect air line from power divider control.
Disconnect drive shafts from input and output shaft end yokes. Refer to GROUP 06 - PROPELLER SHAFTS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the correct procedure to remove the shafts.
Remove output shaft bearing retainer bolts. Use a soft hammer to loosen bearing retainer from axle housing. Remove bearing cage and output shaft from axle housing.
Loosen differential carrier-to-axle housing bolts. Remove all bolts except top two. These two bolts will prevent carrier assembly from falling.

note.para: Removal slots ( Figure 5) are provided at two locations on carrier flange, inter-axle differential case, and input shaft bearing retainer. Use suitable pry bar to separate components.

step1.para: Support carrier assembly on roller jack. Secure as necessary to prevent carrier from falling from jack when removed from housing.
Be certain carrier is balanced properly on jack, and remove top two carrier mounting bolts. Remove carrier assembly from axle housing.
Roll carrier assembly from under truck.
Mount carrier assembly in suitable rebuild stand. (Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.)
